com.box.androidlib.FileTransfer
Class BoxFileUpload

java.lang.Object
  com.box.androidlib.FileTransfer.BoxFileUpload

public class BoxFileUpload
extends java.lang.Object

Contains logic for uploading to Box and reporting errors that may have occurred. You should not call this directly, and instead use Box.upload(String, String, String, long, FileUploadListener) or com.box.androidlib.BoxSynchronous#upload(String, String, File, String, long, FileUploadListener) to download.

Author:
developers@box.net

Method Detail

setListener

public void setListener(FileUploadListener listener,
                        Handler handler)
Set an upload listener which allows you to monitor download progress and see the response status.

Parameters:
listener - A file upload listener. You will likely be interested in callbacks FileUploadListener.onProgress(long) and FileUploadListener.onComplete(BoxFile, String)
handler - The handler through which FileUploadListener.onProgress will be invoked.

execute

public FileResponseParser execute(java.lang.String action,
                                  java.io.File file,
                                  java.lang.String filename,
                                  long destinationId)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                  java.io.FileNotFoundException
Execute a file upload.

Parameters:
action - Set to Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD or Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY
file - A File resource pointing to the file you wish to upload. Make sure File.isFile() and File.canRead() are true for this resource.
filename - The desired filename on Box after upload (just the file name, do not include the path)
destinationId - If action is Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD, then this is the folder id where the file will uploaded to. If action is Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY, then this is the file_id that is being overwritten, or copied.
Returns:
A FileResponseParser with information about the upload.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can be thrown if there is no connection, or if some other connection problem exists.
java.io.FileNotFoundException - File being uploaded either doesn't exist, is not a file, or cannot be read
java.net.MalformedURLException - Make sure you have specified a valid upload action
